Context:
The George Brown College offers various Academic Upgrading programs to improve reading, writing, math, science, and computer skills for 1-3 semesters. These programs help students get ready for college, meet entrance requirements, or gain a credential to improve job opportunities. There are different types of programs available:

1. A full-time program with an email address: upgradinginfo@georgebrown.ca and phone number 416-415-5000 ext. 3560.
2. Distance (online) learning with an email address: choices@georgebrown.ca.
3. An upgrading program for Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing students to improve their American Sign Language (ASL) skills with an email address: deafupgrading@georgebrown.ca.
4. An online literacy program for Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing adults in Ontario with a website: Deaf Learn Now.
5. A 3-week program to prepare mature students for the Mature Student Assessment Test with an email address: evitello@georgebrown.ca and phone number 416-415-5000 ext. 3753, and another email address: gbcdegreebridging@georgebrown.ca.

All of these programs are offered at the St. James Campus located at 200 King Street East, Toronto. Prospective students can book a campus tour or explore the campus through a virtual tour. The college has an Academic Upgrading Information email address: upgradinginfo@georgebrown.ca, and other contact details include phone number 415-5000 with ext. numbers 3560, 3753, and TTY number 1-877-515-5559. The college's social media hub can also be visited for more information.

The programs offered are subject to change without notice and should not be considered as a representation, offer, or warranty. Students are advised to verify George Brown College fee requirements.
